ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The Garden will be brought near to those who have taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (On that Day) the Garden will be brought near to the God-fearing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On the Day of Judgment Paradise will be brought near
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And Paradise will be brought close for the pious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And Paradise will be brought near to those who had Taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the garden shall be brought near for those who guard (against evil),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And Paradise shall be brought forward for the godfearing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When Paradise shall be brought near to the God-fearing
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the Garden shall be brought nigh to the God, fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and paradise will be brought near for the Godwary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: To the righteous, the Garden will be brought near,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and Paradise shall be brought forward to the cautious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Paradise will be brought near for the righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:90] And Paradise will be brought near for the God-fearing, and they will [be able to] see it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil)) disbelief, idolatry, and indecencies, becoming thus their abode.
